problems.question: Solve the following equation. Verify your solution. 2 − (2x + 2) = 2(x + 3) + x

Which of the following represents the solution to a system of linear equations on graphs? 󰄰 󰄰 󰄰 󰄰 The slopes of the lines The x-intercepts of the lines The y-intercepts of the lines The point at which the lines intersect

B It lies in the second quadrant of the coordinate plane. C It is the only point that satisfies both equations simultaneously. D It is one of many points that satisfies both equations simultaneously.

Two lines are graphed on the same coordinate plane. The lines only intersect at the point (3,6). Which of these systems of linear equations could represent two lines?  Select all that apply.

Consider the system of equations. y = 2x + 2, y = 6x + 2. Which statements are true about the system of equations? The graph of the system consists of lines that have no points of intersection. The graph of the system consists of lines that have exactly one point of intersection. The graph of the system consists of lines that have more than one point of intersection. The system has no solution. The system has exactly one solution. The system has more than one solution.

Solve the system of linear equations graphically. If there is one solution, verify that your solution satisfies both equations. y = 3x + 1 and x + y = 5. If there is no solution, write 'no solution'. If there are infinitely many solutions, write 'infinitely many solutions'. If there is one solution, write your answer in the format: (x,y) with no spaces.
Solve the system of linear equations graphically. If there is one solution, verify that your solution satisfies both equations. y = −5 and 2x + y = −3.
Solve the system of linear equations graphically. If there is one solution, verify that your solution satisfies both equations. y = −3x + 4 and y = 2.
Solve the system of linear equations graphically. If there is one solution, verify that your solution satisfies both equations. x − 2 and y = x + 4.
Solve the system of linear equations graphically. If there is one solution, verify that your solution satisfies both equations. y = 6x − 6 and y = 3x − 6.
Solve the system of linear equations graphically. If there is one solution, verify that your solution satisfies both equations. 2x + y = −4 and y + 2x = 3.

The equation of line s is y = 3x − 3. The equation of line t is y = −x + 5. The equations of lines s and t form a system of equations. The solution to the system of equations is located at point P. Draw and plot.
If the system of equations has infinitely many solutions, which statement must be true? A. No shared points. B. One shared point. C. No common values. D. All common values.
Use a graph to find x and y values that make both y = −(1/3)x + 3 and y = 2x − 5 true.
Solve these without writing anything down: x = 5, y = x − 7, y = 4, y = x + 3, x = 8, y = −11.
Use the lines to decide whether each statement is true or false. 1. 8 = −x + 10, 2. 2 = 2x + 4, 3. −x + 10 = 2x + 4, 4. No values satisfy both y = −x + 10 and y = 2x + 4.
